data.title: Bryant Stibel Internship Program
data.meta_description: Pepperdine Graziadio launched two, seven-week classes preparing students for an internship opportunity with Bryant Stibel, a private equity firm.
data.text:
Alexander Mrkalj

Alexander Mrkalj is a Master of Science in Applied Finance (MSAF) candidate at Pepperdine's Graziadio Business School. At Pepperdine, he is a student-athlete, competing on the Men's Volleyball Team, works for Housing and Residence Life as a Graduate Assistant, and is a member of Pepperdine's Finance Club. In 2023, Alexander graduated from Princeton University, majoring in Economics and minoring in Entrepreneurship, where he was the captain of the Men's Volleyball Team, President of Cannon Dial Elm Eating Club, and was awarded the Spirit of Princeton Award at graduation. Alexander has professional experience within finance, startups, and venture capital, most recently interning as a Research Associate at Chaac Ventures. He is excited to continue honing his financial knowledge through Pepperdine's MSAF program and the Bryant Stibel class. In his free time, he enjoys exercise, reading, playing board games, and trying new cuisines.

Amanda Hinchey

Amanda Hinchey is a graduate student pursuing a Master of Science in Applied Finance at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School. She earned her bachelor's degree in Business Management from the University of Wyoming in 2018, where she was a member of the women's golf team. Following her undergraduate studies, Amanda gained experience in the U.S. Senate and corporate restructuring field before deciding to further her education. She is currently representing Pepperdine University on the CFA Institute Research Challenge Team and is the co-VP of the Graziadio Business School Finance Club. While pursuing her master’s she is learning to surf and enjoys staying active and spending time with family and friends in her free time.

Brandon Martin

Brandon Martin is a Full-Time MBA student at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School. He was born and raised in Martinsville, VA and received his Bachelors in Economics from Christopher Newport University in Newport News, VA. Prior to moving to California for his MBA Brandon worked for Wells Fargo Advisors as a Trading Service Representative (held Series 7 and 63) and also served as an Account Manager for a consumer goods startup. Brandon’s goal is to become an angel investor or perhaps start a company of his own. In his spare time he enjoys playing tennis, working out, driving fast, and listening to alternative rock bands.

Eddie Khachikian

Eddie Khachikian is currently pursuing his Full-time MBA here at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School with a concentration in Finance and Entrepreneurship and is set to graduate in April 2025. He received a B.B.A. with Honors in Finance from the University of Iowa, Tippie College of Business in May 2021. Eddie has a notable level of experience in the field of business, especially in accounting and finance, having worked as a tax associate as well as being a financial specialist for a niche, worldwide travel agency. He is particularly passionate about investment banking and strategic finance and is looking forward to gaining experience and growing his knowledge throughout his MBA program. Additionally, he is fluent in Armenian as a first language, and enjoys music, basketball, computer building and technology, and learning more about finance and the economy.

Jack Steinberg

Jack Steinberg is attaining a Fully Employed MBA (FEMBA) with a concentration in finance at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School, with an anticipated graduation in August 2024. Born and raised in Los Angeles, Jack obtained his Bachelor of Arts degree from the University of California, Santa Barbara. His professional journey spans over a decade in the finance and real estate sectors, beginning with a pioneering role in a venture that specialized in virtual property tours.

For the past six years, Jack has been a pivotal member of 1997 Adams Investors, serving as an Asset Manager. In this capacity, he is entrusted with the critical responsibilities of developing investment strategies and managing risk, particularly in the commercial and industrial real estate markets of the Greater Los Angeles area. Upon completing his MBA, Jack is prepared to further his proficiency in the financial sector by pursuing the CAIA Level I certification. His career aspirations are firmly rooted in Private Equity and Venture Capital, where he aims to leverage his extensive experience and academic accomplishments.

Outside the professional arena, Jack is an avid sports enthusiast, passionately supporting the Los Angeles Lakers and Dodgers. He also enjoys engaging in outdoor activities, including beach volleyball and snowboarding.

Kathleen Holihan

Kathleen is a Master’s of Applied Finance student at the Pepperdine Graziadio Business School. She graduated from Sonoma State University in 2018 with a degree in business administration. Kathleen later completed the post-graduate Paralegal Certificate Program at University of California, Irvine, and the Professional Fiduciary courses at California State University, Fullerton. She worked as a paralegal in employment law and a client service associate for a financial services firm. She later joined a residential mortgage brokerage as a loan processor. Immediately prior to attending Pepperdine, Kathleen held a position at a commercial real estate development firm as assistant to the CEO and project coordinator, overseeing acquisitions, sales, and loans. In her free time, Kathleen enjoys cooking and dogs. Upon graduation, Kathleen is looking forward to a career in financial services or corporate restructuring.

Kexin Lin

Kexin Lin is currently pursuing her MS degree in Business Analytics. Prior to joining Pepperdine, she graduated from Auburn University with a Bachelor of Science in Supply Chain Management. In her last role at A.P. Moller Maersk, the world's largest container shipping company, she was part of the global control tower team in North America of a global account where she managed complex supply chain processes, and demonstrated her ability to apply analytical skills in business. She also had experiences with demand planning and autonomous trucking. Observing the transformation of the supply chain industry into one of the most profitable sectors during pandemic sparked a profound shift in her professional interest and fueled her curiosity to delve deeper into the finance world. Her journey in the logistics and supply chain sector has imbued her with the confidence to gain a deeper understanding of financial mechanisms and strategic decision-making. Upon graduating, Kexin intends to pursue a career in management consulting or tech. In her free time, Kexin enjoys CrossFit, traveling, music, and food.

Kian Nader

Kian Nader is currently pursuing his M.S. in Applied Finance at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School and will graduate in August 2024. He attended Loyola Marymount University for his undergraduate degree in Economics with a minor in Biology. At LMU, Kian played division I basketball for two years with the LMU Men’s Basketball Team. He has worked at a mortgage bank as a loan processor since 2020. During quarantine in 2020, Kian also created a startup company that still functions today, which is called Athlete Training Match. Upon graduation he plans on working as an analyst at a real estate investment/private equity firm. Outside of academics and work, Kian enjoys surfing, playing golf, and playing tennis whenever he can with his friends.

Langston Sheppard

Langston is a MSB student at Pepperdine Graziadio, with an expected graduation date of August 2024. He holds a Bachelor of Science in Political Science from Lincoln University, the nation’s first HBCU as well as a Doctorates of Jurisprudence from the University of Pittsburgh School of Law, primarily focused on transactional law, private equity, and M&A. He has held a diverse array of positions from clerking for Federal Judge Andrew Edison, to sitting as a board member for non-profit organizations like The Green Wood Plan and interning in the legal department of fortune 500 mineral conglomerate Alcoa. His experiences have granted him a wide range of expertise across various aspects of corporate finance as it applies to his passion. Through the promulgation of a global impact, he seeks to utilize conscientious business strategy to effect change socially and economically, in pursuit of that mission he has visited more than 20 countries. Currently he is interested in business strategy related roles in Los Angeles, California. In his spare time, he enjoys reading, music, tea, travel, and swimming in the ocean.

Leo Liao

Leo Liao is a Master’s in Real Estate student concentrating in investment and finance at Pepperdine University. Before the Pepperdine real estate program, Leo had work experience in the construction industry and worked as an intern at a consulting service firm. Leo was a Financial Enterprise Risk and Compliance consultant intern at EY (Ernest & Young ) Business Advisory for approximately six months. During this internship, Leo did in-depth research on the topic Basel 3rd, assist created a methodology of digitalization of audit, and helped the team with risk analysis and reporting to its clients. The client list includes commercial banks, investment securities, and insurance companies. After finishing the Master in Real Estate program, Leo hoped to combine what he learned from the Bryant Stibel Program and pursue a career in the alternative investment world.

Martin De Chavarria Munoz

Martin is currently pursuing a Master of Science in Real Estate at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School. He graduated magna cum laude from New Jersey Institute of Technology, earning a business degree with a concentration in Finance. He is the president of Pepperdine’s Real Estate Association and a student-athlete playing volleyball for the school. Martin interned at Ernst and Young last summer in their Real Estate Strategy and Transactions department, where he had an active role in the acquisition of a private debt fund specializing in short-term bridge loans. Additionally, he spent several summers training and traveling with the Spanish Volleyball National Team as their youngest player.

Matthew Boyer

Matthew Boyer is a Master of Applied Finance student at the Pepperdine Graziadio Business School. Originally from Edwardsville, IL (St. Louis area), he graduated from Wichita State University in 2023 with a degree in Finance, while being a member of the baseball team. Currently, Matthew continues to be a student-athlete on the baseball team now representing Pepperdine. Throughout college, Matthew developed an interest in the real estate market by gaining valuable experience through internships at an appraisal company and a small investment firm. His interests extend to the dynamics of global markets and geopolitics, reflecting his passion for economics. Looking ahead, Matthew hopes to take the CFA exam, pursue a career in finance, and travel.

Nicole Bardi

Nicole Bardi is a current Master of Science in Business (MSB) student at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School. She was Born and raised in Los Angeles, and received her Bachelor of Arts in Psychology at the Seaver College at Pepperdine University. She comes from a family whose passions revolve around real estate and investing. Nicole hopes to gain a better understanding of investments to help contribute to her family dinner table conversations and also pursue a career in consulting or private equity. In her free time, Nicole loves to travel, meet new people, listen to music, workout and live life with a glass half full perspective.

On Tung Yuan

On Tung Yuan is a current student in the MS Business Analytics program at Pepperdine. With an undergraduate degree in finance from Shenzhen University in China. On Tung has successfully passed the CFA Level 1 exam and is actively working towards the next two levels. Her past experiences include an internship at KPMG in Shenzhen, where she participated in the annual audit of a real estate company. On Tung's career passion centers around helping companies make informed decisions through the application of statistical skills. In her spare time, you might find On Tung enjoying musicals or exploring the underwater world through scuba diving.

Spencer Wood

Spencer Wood is currently pursuing his M.S. in Applied Finance at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School and is expected to graduate in August 2024. He graduated from the University of Arizona in 2020, earning a Bachelor of Science Degree in Business Administration with an emphasis in Finance. After graduation, Spencer worked as an administrative assistant for a property management company. Following his graduation from the Graziadio Business School, he plans to pursue a career in finance and investments. In his free time, Spencer enjoys golfing, traveling, music, and spending time with friends and family.

Stanley Li

Stanley (Yuzhong) Li is a Full-time Master of Applied Finance student at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School. Originally from Vancouver, Stanley's passion for entrepreneurship led him to embark on side projects in trade export and app design. With a year experience as a database administrator and two more as an administrative assistant, Stanley's journey into finance was sparked by his interactions with individuals in the field, compelling him to learn more. A graduate of Lancaster University in the United Kingdom with a degree in Management and Information Technologies, Stanley aims to combine his academic foundation with real-world insights. Post-graduation, he wants to work in the financial industry, setting his sights on roles as a financial analyst or in risk assessment. Over time, Stanley is determined to leverage his varied experiences and insights into entrepreneurship, eventually establishing his own business.

Thomas Dewey

Thomas Dewey is currently enhancing his expertise as a Fully Employed MBA candidate at Graziadio Business School. He holds an Honors degree in Marketing with a minor in Finance from DePaul University. Boasting over a decade of experience with leading retailers such as Walmart Inc. and various CPG companies, Thomas has excelled in dissecting and fortifying the dynamic relationships between retailers, consumers, and brands. His strategic initiatives have consistently spurred business growth and delivered value to stakeholders. Since 2021, Thomas has been pivotal in driving growth within Bayer's Consumer Health division, executing M&As, leading industry forecasts, analyzing brand commercialization, and successfully launching over twelve new products. With a solid foundation in strategic and transformational leadership, Thomas is dedicated to applying these skills to advance his career in business development and strategy even further.

Tony Wei Tung Lin

Tony Wei Tung Lin is currently pursuing a Master's degree in Business Analytics from Pepperdine University. He completed his Bachelor's in Communication Studies from Loyola Marymount University with a 3.8 GPA and Dean's List honors. Tony's previous roles include Investment and Digital Marketing Intern at The Interlink Group and Growth Marketing Manager Intern at Cloud Advisory LLC, where he developed skills in creating pitch decks, devising social media strategies, and running cross-platform campaigns. He is fluent in Mandarin and English and holds Inbound Marketing and Business Analytics certifications. Once he graduates, Tony aims to secure a business analysis or tech job and merge his analytical prowess and business strategy acumen. Apart from academics, Tony enjoys investing, traveling, basketball, and snowboarding. The industry's pandemic-driven transformation has piqued his interest in finance, and he is now exploring the deeper intersections of analytics and business strategy. Tony aspires to leverage his diverse skill set to make impactful contributions in his chosen field.

Trang Vo

Trang Vo is currently a Master of Science in Applied Finance (MSAF) student at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School. She earned her degree in Business Administration with a focus on Finance from Loyola Marymount University in 2023. Passionate about finance and quantitative analysis, with the urge to learn, Trang plans to continue exploring these interests after graduation. Trang is a team member of the Pepperdine team in the Global CFA Institute Investment Research Challenge 2024, where she collaborates with a select team to conduct comprehensive equity research and ultimately provide investment recommendations. Post-graduation from Graziadio Business School, she aims to pass the CFA Level I exam and pursue a career in the investment industry. In her free time, she enjoys playing with her cats and engaging in activities like Lagree, Pilates, and tennis."

William Genovese

William Genovese is a Master of Applied Finance candidate at the Pepperdine Graziadio Business School. In 2022, he graduated from the University of Colorado, Boulder, where he played Lacrosse and found his passion for investment management. After working in the financial services industry for a year, he wanted to excel in his career path and pursue a Master’s degree. Will is currently involved in the CFA Institute Research Challenge with his other team members at Pepperdine, advancing his financial education and experience even further. In his free time, Will enjoys surfing, playing guitar, and working out. After graduation, Will hopes to pursue a career in investment management and excel in the industry.

Yusuke Kanda

Yusuke Kanda is a first-year MBA student at Pepperdine Graziadio. Born in Japan and raised in Switzerland, England, and Canada, he earned his BBA from Mount Royal University in Calgary,

Alberta. Prior to joining Pepperdine, Yusuke worked as a corporate strategy analyst in an Oil & Gas consulting firm and as a Commercial Property Underwriter at an Insurance and Financial Services Company. In his leisure time, Yusuke enjoys exercising, with hobbies that include watching sports—especially soccer, basketball, and football—and traveling the world. Post- graduation from Pepperdine, Yusuke aspires to pursue a career in enterprise strategy, collaboratively developing effective strategies to transform significant opportunities into concrete success while shaping the company's future direction.

James Heyworth

James Heyworth is a Master`s of Applied Finance candidate at the Pepperdine Graziadio Business School. In 2022, he graduated from Westcliff University with a degree in Business Administration while bringing his lifelong baseball career to a close. James has an affinity for problem solving and holds a passion for finance that he plans to continue cultivating after graduation. In his free time, he enjoys hiking, surfing, and playing tennis. James is currently representing Pepperdine University in the Global CFA Institute Investment Research Challenge alongside a small team of hand-selected students tasked with in-depth financial analysis and quantitative forecasting. Following his graduation from the Graziadio Business School, James plans on taking the CFA level one exam and pursuing a career in finance and investments.

Ivy Cheng

Ivy Cheng is a Master of Science in Business (MSB) student at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School. She was born in Beijing, China, but grew up in New York City. Before attending Pepperdine, she earned a Bachelor of Business Administration in Strategic Design and Management from Parsons School of Design. Her interests include digital marketing, quantitative research and analysis, and public speaking. She has extensive experience in a wide range of industries over the last few years, including fitness, retail, real estate, and financial publishing. She is currently aiming to use the knowledge and skills she gained from the MSB program to transition into a career in business strategy consulting. In her spare time, she enjoys boxing and listening to entrepreneurship podcasts.

Kalena Teufel

Kalena Teufel is currently attending Pepperdine University working towards getting her Master of Applied Finance at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School. Kalena received a BBA in Finance and Economics from the University of San Francisco on a full sports/ academic scholarship while being a four-year starter on the Women’s soccer team. She was on the West Coast Conference All-Academic team for two years. Kalena also coached and mentored young female soccer players during her time in San Francisco. After college, she worked at Cubex, an inventory management software company. Kalena now works as a Sales Associate at Gorjana during her Master’s Program. During her free time, Kalena enjoys being active, cooking, spending time with family, and surfing.

Abdul Badawiya

Abdul Badawiya is currently pursuing a Master of Science in Applied Finance at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School; he is expected to graduate in August 2023. He is a member of the Finance club and a CFA competition team member for the University. He holds a Bachelor of Business Administration in finance from University of California Riverside. He has experience as a financial analyst at Ennkar, where he has been responsible for analyzing companies' accounting, supervising the processing department, and restructuring the company blueprint to optimize revenue. He also has experience as a mortgage consultant at Option One Mortgage Lending, where he was responsible for developing new clients, analyzing assets and liabilities, and leading a team of 4 members. In his free time, Abdul enjoys working out in the gym and playing all types of sports.

Yiting Yan

Yiting Yan is a Full-time MBA student at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School. Before exploring the business world, she practiced law for years dealing with financial and commercial cases. She holds a master’s degree in law concentrating in International Commercial Arbitration from Pepperdine Law School and has a New York attorney license. With a law background, she is looking to expand her career in business finance. Additionally, she is interested in providing professional strategies and consulting to facilitate and support building more orderly and harmonious communities. In her spare time, she enjoys playing tennis and tasting tea.

Dennis Blyashov

Dennis is currently pursuing his M.S. in Applied Finance at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School and is set to graduate in August 2023. He received his A.B. in Economics and minor in Neuroscience from Harvard College in May 2021, where he also studied abroad at DIS Copenhagen, specializing in Global Economics. Dennis has a wealth of experience in sales and consulting, having worked at several tech startups and Simon Kucher Partners. He aims to sharpen his due diligence and evaluation skills through his graduate studies and pursue a career in the investment space. Dennis is a 2-time All-American athlete earning recognition under both the Harvard and Pepperdine’s water polo teams and has represented the USA Youth National Team in international tournaments. In his free time, Dennis enjoys surfing, being outdoors, music, self-improvement, traveling, and personal finance.

Christian Deindoerfer

Christian Deindoerfer is a driven and dedicated professional currently pursuing a Master's degree in Real Estate at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School and participating in the Bryant Stibel program. In addition to his studies, Christian has recently spearheaded the team that won the 2022 Colvin Case Study Challenge, a national competition held yearly at the Maryland School of Architectural design. This demonstrates his passion and commitment to the real estate industry and highlights his skills and expertise. Christian is also an accomplished individual outside of his professional life. He enjoys playing piano, exploring the great outdoors, traveling to new places to experience different cultures, and trying fresh foods. His diverse interests and skills give him a well-rounded perspective, which he brings to his future endeavors.

Charles Cooper

Charles Cooper is part of the Fully Employed MBA program at Pepperdine University’s Graziadio

Business School. Charles was born and raised in Los Angeles, California and received his bachelor’s degree from the University of California, Santa Cruz, majoring in Business Management Economics.

After college, Charles worked in a banking institute for a couple of years before transitioning to the aerospace and defense industry in various financial positions where he has worked for 15 years.

Charles currently works as a corporate real estate analyst leading strategic initiatives in synergy and efficiency. Charles also has his California real estate broker’s license and has been practicing real estate for over a decade. Charles’ hobbies include playing sports especially soccer and traveling the world. After graduating from Pepperdine, Charles hopes to pursue a career in strategic management with intent in a venture capital firm.

Michael Sugiarto

Meet Michael, a highly motivated individual with a passion for finance and economics. Born and raised in Indonesia, Michael has a diverse cultural background that has shaped his unique perspective on life. He holds a Bachelor of Arts in Economics from California State University, Northridge where he worked as a student portfolio manager for the university’s endowment fund. Prior to joining Pepperdine, Michael worked in the supply chain department at Emtek Products, where he managed inventory, procured raw materials, and controlled a procurement budget. In his role, he learned about financial and supply chain management, which led him to pursue a master’s in applied finance at Pepperdine. Upon graduation, Michael plans to pursue a career in corporate finance or management consulting. Michael is an enthusiast of Brazilian Jiu Jitsu, and enjoys watching movies and playing the guitar in his free time.

Caden Van Dahm

Caden Van Dahm is part of the 5-year BS/MBA program at Graziadio, set to graduate in April with an MBA in finance and a bachelor’s degree in international business. Over the course of his education, he has worked for the Arizona State Treasury as an Investment Intern, as well as Northwestern Mutual as a Financial Representative. These experiences, along with his coursework, have fostered a passion for finance and the study of financial health. To move this interest forward, Caden plans to start his career as a financial analyst, and progress toward being a consultant.

Chase Wonders

Chase Wonders is a first year in the Full-Time MBA Program. His work experience in finance is on the brokerage side and he is looking to make the transition to the investment side. He is passionate about risk management and is firmly dedicated to expanding his knowledge of derivatives both educationally and experientially. In addition, he plans to pursue a CAIA certification. In his spare time, he enjoys reading philosophy and his favorite recreational activities include skiing, tennis and squash.

Brianna Piacitelli

Brianna Piacitelli is currently pursuing a Master’s in Real Estate with a concentration in Investments and Finance at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School. She has over six years of experience in the commercial real estate industry. Before coming to Pepperdine, Brianna worked as a commercial real estate broker at Newmark, advising property owners on the redevelopment and leasing strategies of office and laboratory properties in Greater Boston. Before becoming a broker, she worked as a leasing analyst at JLL, developing discounted cash flow models to support lease negotiations and informed decision-making. Following graduation, she plans to work in real estate acquisitions or development.

Di Mao

I came to the United States from China to pursue my undergraduate degree in accounting in 2011 and have claimed here as my second home since then. A very unique opportunity to join the US Army showed up after college so I spent four years in Fort Hood, TX. Upon completion of the service, I chose Pepperdine MSRE to further educate myself in the business and finance setting. It has been an amazing experience to get back to school and learn things that I am passionate about. I have conducted 1031 exchange and started to build my portfolio of residential rental investments here in LA and Ventura. I would like to start my career in financial analysis/credit underwriting in real estate with my accounting background. I like exploring the underwater world. I have been a scuba diver for 5 years and have been to Florida and Tulum Mexico because of their magnificent underwater cave systems. It is very interesting to learn about the history of the earth by looking at fossils and lime stones that take millions of years to form.

Aaron Kash

Aaron Kash is currently a first year MBA Candidate at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School who seeks to pursue a career in the Financial Services Industry. After interning as a Private Equity Associate for Kiva Capital Partners last Fall, he has shifted his educational focus to financial analysis and solving real world business problems. Aaron's professional experience working with larger institutions including Bank of America, Wells Fargo, and Raymond James has provided him with excellent business skills to excel in a collaborative environment. A world-class education at both UCLA and Pepperdine Graziadio

Business School has equipped him with the necessary expertise to secure a career in the

Investment Industry.

Ashton Tate

Ashton Tate is a Part-time MBA student at Pepperdine University’s Graziadio Business School. Ashton grew up in Maitland, Florida, and he received his bachelor’s degree from The University of North Florida, majoring in Finance & Economics. After college, Ashton worked in the Oil & Gas business as a market analyst and now works in the REIT industry. He is a firm believer in the speaking organization Toastmasters, and credits it as one of his best educational experiences. Ashton is fascinated by geopolitical events and their effects on the financial markets, and his hobbies include weightlifting, reading, and playing guitar & piano.

Xingcen Liu

Xingcen is a Master of Applied Finance student at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School. She grew up in the mountains of northern China and has loved nature. Before Pepperdine, she completed a pre-veterinary program at North Carolina State University and was on track to become a veterinarian. She has five years of experience in veterinary medicine and has worked for Banfield Pet Hospitals, the largest veterinary hospital chain in the US; Vetted Petcare, a YCombinator pet startup; and Love at First Mutt, an LA-based animal nonprofit. She discovered her passion for entrepreneurship after witnessing many unique challenges in the veterinary business. She wishes to bring positive changes to the traditional veterinary business using modern business and financial skills. After graduation, she plans to work as a management consultant specializing in the veterinary industry, and eventually, she wishes to launch her own veterinary business. During her free time, Xingcen enjoys volunteer and outdoor activities. During COVID, she started a disaster relief nonprofit and is a current financial literacy teacher at Operation Hope.

Joseph Waugh

Joseph Waugh is a second-year full time MBA candidate at Pepperdine Graziadio concentrating in finance and entrepreneurship. Joseph graduated with a bachelors of business administration with an emphasis in marketing from Concordia University Wisconsin. Prior to joining Pepperdine Joseph worked as an account executive for a SaaS start-up in Los Angeles where discovered an interest in how great products can make incredible businesses with large amounts of scalability. Outside of undergrad Joseph continued to learn about finance, alternative investments, and how markets work by reading various books on these subjects and being a market participant. This interest in finance led him towards getting his MBA at Pepperdine, where he intends to leverage his knowledge & experience into successfully building and scaling a business. In his free time, Joseph has an affinity for music, movies, and hiking.

Kevin Mirand

Kevin Mirand is a second-year, fulltime MBA candidate with a finance concentration at Pepperdine’s Graziadio Business School. In 2020, he graduated with a bachelor’s of science degree in Business Administration and an Applied Math Minor at Pepperdine University, Seaver College. Kevin has had past experience as a licensed loan officer at Total Quality Lending and as a Wealth Management Intern at UBS Financial Services. Currently he has accepted an analyst internship with Probity International, a luxury real estate developer in Beverly Hills, and will pursue a future role in alternative investments with a focus in real estate. Outside of the day-to-day routine, Kevin enjoys outdoor activities such as hiking, scuba diving, and surfing, as well as other extracurricular activities such as student-pilot training for helicopters and fixed wing aircraft.

Stefani Feldman

Stefani is a second year MBA candidate studying finance at Pepperdine University under a scholarship from Graziadio Business School and Seaver College's Music Department. She is also VP of Events of Graziadio's Finance Club. Following graduation, Stefani hopes to pursue a career in investment management. With over 15 years of experience in the Classical Music Industry as a performer, educator and strategic administrative member, Stefani has worked with different ensembles around the world, including the Norwegian Radio Orchestra and Moscow Symphony Orchestra. After receiving a B.M. from USC Thornton School of Music, she culminated her music performance studies with a Fulbright Scholarship in Oslo, Norway. Stefani mentors for the Fulbright Lotus Program, a diversity initiative to support Asian Fulbrighters around the world.

Shubham Gajera

Shubham is a 2nd year MBA Finance Candidate at Pepperdine University’s Graziadio Business School. He graduated in 2020 with a Bachelor’s of Science in Business Administration from Pepperdine University’s, Seaver College. His experience includes roles centered around corporate finance and supply chain management. Shubham has had real-world experience with Mergers & Acquisitions through participating in negotiations and due-diligence proceedings. Likewise, his interactions with Private Equity firms have grown his passion for the private capital markets. Upon graduation, Shubham plans to pivot into a career in wealth management services and alternative investments. In his past time, he enjoys playing basketball and tennis and traveling with friends and family.

Alexandros Giannakitsidis

My name is Alexandros Giannakitsidis and I am originally from South Africa. I am in the MSBA program at Pepperdine University. I previously graduated from Siena College with a bachelors in Finance. I previously interned at Goldman Sachs Ayco Personal Financial Management and have worked at Amerisave Mortgage Corporation as a Jr. Underwriter which had handled $1B in mortgages during the first three months of 2021. Using the skills from my undergraduate degree and with my education at Pepperdine I wish to pursue a career with equity analysis at a hedge fund or pursue a role at a Fintech firm. I currently live in West LA and am a former division one tennis player. My other hobbies include e-sports, exploring, and eating.

Oliver Stein

Oliver is a full-time MBA student at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School, expected to graduate in April 2023 with concentrations in Finance and Entrepreneurship. Oliver grew up in Los Angeles before attending Indiana University where he majored in Sport Marketing and Management. After college, he moved to New York City where he worked in the entertainment industry - first, as an assistant at a leading talent agency and then as chief of staff to the chairman of a prolific independent film studio. Oliver then was promoted internally and served as Director of Development, Production, and Acquisitions for the studio wherein he shepherded internal projects and sought out films to acquire for theatrical distribution. After some extended time traveling was cut short by the pandemic, he decided the next step in his career would be to continue his education. Upon completing his MBA, Oliver plans to utilize his past experience and newly bolstered toolkit to transition into a strategic role in the media sector.

Shant Ganoumian

Shant Ganoumian is part of the 5-year BS/MBA program at Graziadio, concentrating in finance. He will graduate in April with an MBA in finance and a bachelor’s in business administration. His coursework at Graziadio has allowed him to develop his passion at the intersection between traditional finance and the ever-growing world of digital assets and cryptocurrencies. As the son of a small business owner, Shant has grown up with an entrepreneurial spirit and a drive to make a difference in his social environment. He has internship experience at Tesla as an onboarding partner and in data analytics. In his spare time, he enjoys watching the Lakers and doing cryptocurrency research. Upon graduation, Shant aims to pursue a career in investment management with a focus on digital assets.

Duo Mao

My name is Mao. Dou. I am originally from Jiangsu, China. I am in the MSBA program at Pepperdine University. I previously graduated from University of California Irvine with a bachelor’s degree in Mathematics. I previously interned at Shang Private Equity as an industry analyst, focusing on technology that includes new energy, semi-conductor, and data storage etc. I generated weekly report that helped the portfolio manager invested 20,000,000 Yuan in secondary market. I wish to use my skills and passion to pursue a career in equity companies as stock analyst. My hobbies are basketball, Rubik’s cubes, e-sports and exploring foods.

Tony June

Tony M. June is an entrepreneur and aspiring portfolio manager, in the process of building a business & real estate brokerage firm. The corporation, Life Connoisseurs Management & Enterprise, will be comprised of three main business drivers. Life Connoisseurs (main business) will buy, build, and sell companies for profit. Connoisseurs Property Development will focus on investment and development of middle-market housing and mixed-use destinations in international markets until we grow a portfolio large enough to convert to a REIT. Wealth Connoisseurs, our private equity firm will be an alternative investment vehicle that invests in the prop-tech space and blockchain technology projects to help advance smart city building. All will work together to drive returns and contribute to an ecosystem for millennial spirited individuals who care to LEARN. EARN. ADVENTURE. Tony is currently pursuing a Master’s in Real Estate (MSRE) with a concentration in Investment and Finance. He is transitioning from 10-years of active service for the US Navy, where he served as an operations and maintenance supervisor in the Nuclear Propulsion Program.

Ilya Khramtsov

Ilya Khramtsov is a Fully Employed MBA student who is innately curious about exploring economics and finance while building upon his analytical background in mathematics from the University of Illinois. Ilya is making a career pivot following half a decade of service in health care in Southern and Northern California while working at Cedars-Siani and Kaiser Permanente – that is currently sponsoring his studies through the corporate relation program. Ilya enjoys hiking national parks in his free time, exploring local cuisine, and recently started sailing in New Port Beach. He would like to leverage his expert generalist background to join a consulting practice, alternatively, explore options within financial services.

Stephanie Stricker

Stephanie is a second year full time MBA candidate at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School studying a concentration in finance. She graduated from The Juilliard School with a Bachelor of Fine Arts in dance as well as the University of Missouri with a Bachelor of Health Science and a minor in Business with Magna Cum Laude. Her most recent internship was with EKK investments, a government contracting company based in Los Angeles. Her responsibilities included future contract due diligence and financial modeling for current operations. She took the Bryant Stibel course because of her interest in venture capital and looking to pursue VC after graduation. She is currently working with the Los Angeles Rams Organization as a cheerleader.

Baltazar Moreno Fuentes

Baltazar is a first-year MBA student at Graziadio Business School. He is a Civil Industrial Engineer who graduated from University Adolfo Ibanez in Chile in 2018. Prior to joining Pepperdine, he worked in Inversiones BanChile, a leading financial institution in Chile. He also worked in his family's real estate business. Since March 2020, he has been responsible for managing a significant portion of his family’s hedge fund. Baltazar decided to pursue his MBA to upgrade his financial skills and become a better investor and manager. Following graduation, he plans to work as an investment manager for both his capital and third parties. In his spare time, he likes to practice different sports such as kitesurfing, surfing, tennis, and snowboarding.

Shawn Bhatia

Shawn is a first-year full-time MBA candidate at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School and graduated from The University of Houston with a Bachelor of Business Administration in Finance. He previously served as the Senior Associate for Member Services at The Heritage Foundation. He was part of the foundation's membership team, responsible for keeping in touch with its 500,000+ members. Bhatia previously worked in various roles at Stand Together, a philanthropic community led by Charles Koch, and is an alumnus of the Koch Associate Program, Koch Fellow Program, and Koch Internship Program. Additionally, he completed internships at The Leadership Institute, Congressman Ted Poe's office, and the Sikh American Legal Defense Education Fund. Shawn enjoys biking, traveling, listening to podcasts, and exploring restaurants in the Los Angeles area in his free time.

Ian (Yiheng) Zhang

Ian is currently pursuing his master’s degree of Applied Finance at Pepperdine Graziadio Business School. He also holds a bachelor’s degree of Economics from George Mason University. Ian also worked as a Quantitative Research Intern at Rebellion Research in New York. Ian has a keen interest in market research, data visualization and financial analysis. In addition to his academic experience in finance, he has worked as a Data Analyst and Business Analyst Intern at top rated investment companies in China and participated in several IPO projects and PPP projects. After graduation, he plans to embark his career in the financial area, especially in investment banking division.

Yankee (Yangyi) Guo

Yankee is a second-year MBA candidate graduating in April 2021. He was born and raised in Beijing, China, and has extensive brand marketing experience before coming to Pepperdine. He’s been working with BMW China’s central marketing department for three years and another two and half years with Bayer China event management department. He sparked a strong interest in Finance at Pepperdine and is pursuing a concentration in this field. While managing a stock portfolio, he’s also developing his understanding and trading capabilities in the area of commodity futures. After graduation, Yankee plans to work for a private equity firm. He believes he could bring more value to the workplace with his diversified background, global perspective, and determination to succeed. He played collegiate basketball in China, and he also enjoys workout, surfing, hiking, and mostly any sport.

Aliyah Galindo

Aliyah Galindo is a first-year MBA student at Pepperdine Graziadio. Her passion for learning and data-driven mindset has led her to strive for a career in the Financial field. With an undergraduate degree in Finance from the University of Oregon, she is now working as a business analyst for a Fortune 500 insurance company. Her data analytics skills and problem-solving approach have been instrumental in delivering high impact results on vital projects. This includes acquiring some of the most profitable accounts while heading the diversity and inclusion initiative for the West Coast division. The financial background she brings, coupled with her eagerness to face any challenge head-on, will be a great asset both in the course and in a professional setting. A double major in Finance and Digital Innovation and Informational Systems will also provide a fresh perspective leading to inventive strategies.

Joseph Theobald

Joseph is a first year MBA Candidate furthering his development as a future business leader. Following five years of active duty service in the U.S. Navy, Joseph graduated Summa Cum Laude from his undergraduate studies at Pepperdine’s Graziadio Business School. He chose Finance as his MBA concentration after discovering a passion for the subject during his undergraduate studies. Joseph is also a lifetime member of the Beta Gamma Sigma International Business Honors Society and has filled a variety of leadership roles, including managing projects around the globe. Joseph aims to strike a balance between the importance of teamwork, while maintaining an independent entrepreneurial spirit. During downtime from studying, you can find him volunteering, tutoring fellow classmates, picking up his guitar, or exploring Southern California's beaches and mountains. Following graduation, he intends to work as an investment manager, with particular interests in sustainable investing and space exploration.

Gabriella Dominic

Gabriella Dominic is an MBA student who is passionate about growing businesses, products, and ideas. She has seven years of pre-MBA experience building and growing private elementary schools and destination development for a cathedral. Her experiences in MarCom allowed her to understand branding, search engines, and the democratization of various content creation tools. She believes that the creator economy and emerging technologies are causing multiple industries to rethink their strategy. She has a budding interest in finance and private equity as she discovered their roles in the creative tools she's been using all along. Gabriella holds a bachelor's degree in Communication from Boston College and is a Golden Key International Honour Society member. After graduating from Pepperdine, she hopes to pursue a career in management consulting.

Luke Poling

Luke is part of the 5-year BS/MBA program at Pepperdine University’s Graziadio Business School. He will graduate in April with an MBA in finance and bachelor’s in business administration. He is fascinated by financial derivatives and has competed in portfolio management competitions for the CME group and tastytrade. His internship experience includes data analytics and equity research. Upon graduation Luke will take the CFA level I exam and pursue a career in investment management. Growing up in Seattle, he is an avid Seattle Seahawks fan and coffee aficionado.

Caleb Arndt

Caleb Arndt is a first-year MBA candidate at Pepperdine Graziadio concentrating in finance. He began his career working for the City of Malibu Planning Department but decided to switch to the private sector after a couple of years. In working for his family wealth management firm, he learned the fundamentals of portfolio construction, as well as how to suss out potential market opportunities. This interest in the financial industry pushed him towards getting his MBA at Pepperdine, where he hopes to leverage his knowledge, experience, and connections into a career in money management within the entertainment industry.

Matthew Moore

Matthew is currently pursuing his MBA degree with a concentration in Finance at Graziadio Business School. He obtained his MSRE degree from Graziadio in August 2020 and also holds a BA in Environmental Studies with a concentration in Energy and Climate from the University of Colorado at Boulder. Prior to business school, Matthew worked at a nationwide consulting firm that specializes in energy efficiency engineering, building sustainability, and renewable energy projects. As a Sustainability Consultant, he managed several energy audits for Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac's green financing programs, as well as green building certifications for California's low-income housing tax credit programs. Matthew also has professional experience working in acquisitions and asset management for various real estate development and investment companies in Los Angeles. An LA native, Mathew enjoys cheering on his beloved Lakers and is an avid beach volleyball player and skier.

An Jiang

An is currently enrolled in the applied finance program at Pepperdine Graziadio. Before coming to Pepperdine, he received a B.A. degree in Economics from UCLA and worked one-year full time as an account manager in a merchant processing services company. An also received his MBA degree from Cal Lutheran. An is currently a CFA level 2 candidate and had traded in the U.S. equity and options market for several years. He had also previously interned at various companies and organizations including the Risk Management Department at Bank of China, Singapore.

Meichen Ye

Mei is a graduate student of MS in Applied Finance program. Prior to attending Pepperdine Graziadio, she has worked as a data analyst in retail industries in both the US and China. She also has worked as an assistant at Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) and Founder Securities. Mei has passed FRM Level II and registered as a candidate for CFA Level I in June 2020. With a huge interest in Leverage Buyout, Mei plans to pursue a career in Private Equity industry upon graduation.

Ben Peters

Ben Peters is a full-time MBA student at Pepperdine Graziadio business school. Ben grew up in San Diego, California, and attended Duke University, where he graduated in 2016. After college, Ben worked in contract manufacturing, where he helped to make efficiency improvements in plants across the United States, and prepare these plants for their sale to strategic and financial buyers. After completing his MBA, he hopes to work at an investment firm where he can use his knowledge of manufacturing to make informed financial decisions. His interests include surfing, fishing, and volunteering for environmentally focused non-profits.

Amanda Callahan

Amanda is a native Texan and studied drama at NYU Tisch School of the Arts. After graduating with honors, she quickly transitioned into arts administration post-graduation. She worked her way up from intern to Administrative Director of Young Actor’s at Strasberg (youth division) at The Lee Strasberg Theatre and Film Institute in New York City over five years. Arrio D. Granum

Arrio D. Granum is a first-year MBA candidate at Pepperdine and has an undergraduate degree in Physics from the United States Military Academy at West Point.
